meta.title: Education First - Cambridge Open Language Database

writing.text: The thunder was crashing, wolves were howling and one could hear a few blood-curdling screams while Hector, an elderly oil tycoon who has been living in a large luxurious house in the middle of Moscow has been attacked. A ruthless burglar had secretly mugged the old man while the middle of the night of the D21st April. The attack was quiet and fierce. MWIt was ACa simple but bloodcurdling hit on Hector's brain with a jewel-encrusted dagger. That is all. Hector fainted, unconscious, his blood was spreading on the ground. As the previous old oil tycoon's aggressors, this mugger were looking for Hector's prized fortune. But this time, Hector failed. He didn't manage to fight with his aggressor as his reflex weren't as vivid as his youth. However, as one the most clear-thinking and wise human beings, Hector had looked forward such an aggression and had installed an alarm in case of a break-in.%% As a result, when the burglar walked across the house, a loud noise crashed and lights from outside appeared. The police wasAGwere there. The burglar was trapped.

writing.topic: Buying a painting for a friend
writing.text: Hey Shelley, RS How's it going RS? I'm sorry for my late response as I had lots to do these last pastWCfew weeks. RS Nevermind, I'll bring you a good news. I got the sand painting you were completely in love with. Do you remember RS? The red, yellow and brown one with the C-shaped design as well as the person with the square face holding both his arms up towards the sky inside. To provide you more details, the person is long and narrow wearing a skirt with an oval on it. I'm sure you have memories now, isn't it RS? RS Anyway, as you really count among my best friend, I offer it PRto you for free. MWYou Don'tCdon't need youPRto pay me back. Just holdWChang it in your living room and have thoughtWCthink forPRof me each time you'llWCyou have a quick look. FYI, I handled the shipment as well and according to the receipt, you should receive it on next Thursday.%% Make sure, you'll be at home to getWCreceive it backD. Send me out Da picture as soon as you hangedWChang it on your wall. RS Miss you, xXx Stella

writing.topic: Writing a report on staff satisfaction
writing.text: The new electronic dictionary is bigger than the others oneWCare. I tried it out myself and I thought it was great. But before you run out to buy one, think about the price. I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw how much they were asking for it: I was rolling on the floor laughing so much it hurtsWChurt. Well, that's not exactly true, but if I were you, I would buy the bigger version than this one. It is better value for sure. You can't deny the fact that it is the best bang for your buck. RS Harry

Hi there, RS As regards to our previous appraisal meeting with Peter and his line manager, we reckoned sending him on a training course MWwhich would be a great opportunity to overcome his problems and develop certain soft skillsPU, MWthrough MWwhich he mayWCcan need to feelMWbe more confident and efficient at work. RS I recently found out the "Holistic Global Management Services" which provides several intensive 'soft skills' training sessions all year-round including courses of self management, communication skills, conflict management as well as intercultural communication skills. RS Regarding to DPeter's profile and expectations, he should attend a 'self management' and a 'conflict management' training sessionPU, as he would learn atPRto settingWCset and meetingWCmeet deadlines as well as at DlisteningWClisten empathetically to his co-workers, RS These training sessions can take the form of one day or weekend workshops following his availabilitiesPU, and last 1,AS 2 or 3 days depending on his personal needs. RS You'll find further information and details on the websitePU, whetherPRif you are still not convinced.%% Best regards,

Hi Janice, RS I am writing to say how terribly sorry I am for Selma's behavior whilePRduring your last dinerSPdinner as I was absolutely not expectedWCaware MWthat Selma asks such offensive questions about money. RS We are all aware how she behaved was very rude and impolitePU, but she certainly didn't mean to offend you. According to me, it might be usual to discuss about the worth of goods, prices of furniture and the level of wages when you meet someone for the first time MWin her culture and she did not feel herEXshe was being tactless. RS Although Im not looking for your forgiveness, I didD just want to let you know how it is difficult to deal with foreign habits and customs when you have never traveled overseas. Indeed, she needs more time to get MWto know how she is supposed to behave withPRin a strangerWCforeignMW culture. RS Obviously, I should have told her about how American people are sensitive but I had no idea it could be such a cultural gap between us.%% Thank you for your understanding and I promise I will never make you feel embarrassed again, RS Tom

A large luxurious house If you ever go to Queenstown in New Zealand, you must toD stay in TheCthe Sunshine Hotel. This Fabulous Hotel is a luxurious house with lake-view rooms. It has a private beach where you can practice water sports, take a special drink at the beach bar or just relax seeing the lake. The Hotel also has an incredible restaurant where you can eat the most delicious sea food of the country. The best dishes are: sea-food chowder, fish and chips and calamari. One of the most important things during your stay here, is the Breakfast! It is made with homemade cakes and fresh and natural fruits. The owner is a germanCGermanPU, who decided to live there. He and his wife are really enjoyable people.

writing.topic: Buying a painting for a friend
writing.text: The survey was answered by 150 employeeshe problem is that the Senior Management work late and the rest of the company feels that they have to do the same. Our recommendation here is to reward them with day off compensation or to change our overtime culture, but this sounds more difficult to implement. B. Employee advance package Most employees are satisfyWCsatisfied with all areas here but the only concern here is that you need to be in the company for two years to be elegibleSPeligible to have the advanced package.%% Our recommendation here is to reduce the time to be elegibleSPeligible from 24 to 18 months. The environment conditions results were good but the only issue here is that they do not receive enough feedback from their bosses. The recommendation here is to change the appraisal process and make it more formal and regular. RS In addition, employees have to wait to much time to make decisions because the process includes too many managers. The recommendation here is to more autonomy to the middle-managers. RS

writing.topic: Buying a painting for a friend
writing.text: concern for others communication skills innovation

writing.topic: Writing a report on staff satisfaction
writing.text: English MWhas changed my life RS,PU. iCI was able to persueSPpursue my dream that is working in the oil and gas industry RS.AS masteringCMastering englishCEnglish gives you that extra and puts you in an advanced positionPU.

I had an awkward situation last month,PU. iCI was in a restaurant and iCI did not like the food that was served PU, so iCI expressed my feeling to my friends PU, andD i didD not realizeVTrealizing that the chef was near our table.

I had a collegueSPcolleague who was playing the game but in a really bad way,PU. I don't think he was DrealisingVTrealised what he was doingPU, but everyone MWelse did. He was really making a fool of him RSself and unfortunately no one stood up to tell him the truthPU, worrying that it would hurt his feelings because he was really fragile. Poor guyPU, iCI did really pittySPpity him.

For the purpose of our company profit improvement I would suggest us to incorporate a new system of the employees work evaluation. We all understand that the human resources are playing extremely important role in the process of gaining the main company's targets. In order to achieve the required job quality we have to madeWCmake a scale, which will help us to measure how the particular job has been done. Let's think about the employee salary that way,AS as we will think about regular investment. I'd say we should describe a few stages for each team member,AS after reaching each ofMW them, we should pay a certain amount of money. First of all we would check what we have for the basic salary. It is Dhave to be clear, that we MWare satisfied by the employee day by day work and if management do not have RS any justified claims to it RS, we will move up to the next level. I propose to give the additional, premium amount for that workers, whoseWCwho has been keen to their work for one year. A double month salary could probably encourage them to keep working good. Finally, I propose to pay team-member sD a sum equal to the 10 percent of the profit which firm made as a result of their idea or innovation; forCFor purpose to stimulate the future company development.%% I'm pretty sure that once we complete the system incorporation, all employees will focus on the company weaknesses for reason to fix it. In addition we'll obtain the more information about quality of the everyday work.

writing.topic: Writing a report on staff satisfaction
writing.text: My native language is Ukrainian, but now, because D I live in Australia RS, RS English is the most importantPU.

To build a successful project you need first to analyse the project. Create a timetable and find out what's the goal and how to achieve it. Afterward you need to establish a team. For that you need to find the right people with the perfect skills for this project and they need to be able to work in a team. Subsequently, bring the team to getterSPtogether. Explain the the project, the the Dgoal of the project, the timetable and the expenses you going to have. Declare the principles of communication and team work and commit everyone to abide by the rules. You should start with a brainstorming to collect all the individual ideas and thoughts. On this way you can see the different skills of your team and how they incorporate. After you found the direction spread the liabilities, set a weekly timetable with meetings among and create a communication platform for exchange and trouble shooting like Email or a blog. Once the team is incorporated, you as manager should review the work with individuals or the team and keep focus on the projects process and goal.

writing.topic: Buying a painting for a friend
writing.text: How to develop good leadership qualities is difficult. I never was a leader. I was usually working in a team where someone else was the leader. For me a good leader should be honest, trustful, with excellent communication skills, a good eye for recognizing problems and a strong personality. He should be able to motivate people as wellMW as giving them constructive criticism. During my years working RSat the hospital I had several team leaders. Most of them were unable to lead a team. What I recognized was, a lot of these leaders losing the esteem for their employee. RS They areVT were toWC too fare SPfar away from reality and practice. They are between the employee and their own wish to succeed. RS I leader has to take decisions whether CWhether is this decision MWis unpopular, like to fire some employee. I don't want to be a leader, becausePR of to WCtoo much stress and a high risk for a early heart attack.

writing.topic: Writing a report on staff satisfaction
writing.text: My mother tongue is germanCGerman,PU. myCMy second language is frenchCFrench and my third is englishCEnglish. Well, I have to say, I speak much better englishCEnglish now than french. RSI never liked to learn other languages at school. For me it was difficult and took a lot of time. I learned englishCEnglish at school when I was 13 years old. Today, linguist proved it's much easier to learn a language when you're young, like 3 to 10 years old. My conviction is, whether you want to learn a language you have to learn it in a country where the people speak the language. After 6 years englishCEnglish at a swiss school, my englishCEnglish was still terrible. It just turned better during the time I had a girlfriend from Slovenia. The only way we could talk to each other was englishCEnglish. SubsequentlyPU, I started extensive travailing through the world. At this time I could improve my englishCEnglish to a higher level. It was the easiest and the best way to meet and communicate with people around the world. Today, I have to say I regret that I didn't pay more attention at school to learn englishCEnglish because now I have to pay for every englishCEnglish course I take and my englishCEnglish is still not perfect.%%

It was last Christmas when I met for the first time the father of my girlfriend. My girlfriends POgirlfriend's family situation is very difficult. He WCHer father is very wealthy. All family members are more or less just interest VTinterested in his money. For my girlfriend it's more important to have more contact with her father. What she told me, was that he pretty much ignored her all his life. When we visited him in his house in east CEast France. Nearly the allWOall the family was there. One evening he took my girlfriend, his son in law and me for a drink in PRto a bar in the next village. I have to say that something like that never happened to me before but when they started again talking about money I lost my RSself. I screamed that my girlfriend and I aren't interestWCweren't interested in his money and that she just want to have a better contact toWCrelationship with him. Apparently I smashed a glass and run VTran out of the bar. My girlfriend drove my WCme home and I went to bed. AtD the CThe next day I couldn't remember a thing. I had a terrible headache and a totally WCtotal black out. I was so embarrassed. I apologized to my girlfriends POgirlfriend's dad.%% He just said it's okay and it wouldn't be a problem. For my girlfriend it was much worse and it took a while until she could forgive me.

I workedVThave worked in different hospitals, in different teams under different management. Usually a team is made up toPRof 80 to 90 percent women and 10 to 20 percent men. Initially, I thought to work in a team with more women asWCthan men would be more peaceful, like less infightingsWCinfighting. Indeed, I was terribleWCterribly wrong. In SwitzerlandPU, hospitals have one of the highest ratePLrates forPRof mobbing. In fact, when the team has a superiorWClarger amount of women, there will be less harmony. There is a lot of backstabbing, blaming and conspiracies. Many times even the team leaders are involved. Specially, insecure and shy people go to the dogs. They'll be used up until they leave or break down. The teams are mostly ruled by nurses with a long team history and a lot of experience. The work is already physical and psychologically demanding enough. I tried several times to talk to the head of the team leader with no success. HoweverPU, I had enough. I changed to a time share company. I still work from time to time in these teams but just for a couple of dayPLdays. After thatPU, I change to a otherWCanother team. I always thought if there were more women in politicsPU, the world would be more peaceful.%% I was disabusedWCmistaken.

Corporate culture is very important toPRfor a successful business. It affects the way people interact with each other and how external stakeholders view the company. To promote a company's culture, a company should have implicit/explicit principles as its guide. These RScan include moral responsibilities, incentives, COand morale. A good manager should be sharp at identifyWCidentifying strengths and weaknesses of the company. He/she should have business acumen;PU, quick at grabbing opportunities when they arise, COand anticipate threats before they happen and give prescient warnings. A good manager should always try to explore ways to build effect teams. For instance, each team member should be assigned to tasks that they do best and be well informed about the task. Members of the team should be enjoy working with others. One way to do that is having social activities outside work. A good manager should be understanding and compassionate. Although profits come first, it is important to keep in mind that a happy employee is more effective,D COand loyal.

writing.topic: Buying a painting for a friend
writing.text: I am not sure if everyone has the potential to be a leader, but certainly, we are not born with leadership skills. These are developed through experience and devotion in learning. A successful company depends on both its leader and its employees. An effective leader should know when to lead and when to follow. They should follow people's good, creative ideas. In regard to this, people skills and empathy is important to put the leader into everyone's shoes and facilitate good discussion. However, in an emergency situation, being autocratic is sometimes more important. There is no much time to get everyone to discuss and agree on the optimal solution. Failing to act quickly could be detrimental. With regard to this, mental agility is a very important characteristic to deal with the matter in a timely and effective manner. A strong leader, with charisma and drive, will help to placate stakeholders in difficult situation, especially in a vertical organisation. A strong leader should have vision and should not always follow the flow. If he/she only does what everyone else does and fearAG fears to take risks then the company might be inPR at the risk of always being a follower in the market.%%

writing.topic: Writing a report on staff satisfaction
writing.text: I came to Australia to study PRfor undergraduate WCgraduation some years ago. In my first year, I could not even understand the lecturers so I had to rely on reading books and guessing the meanings of words. Ironically, I did very well in exams and was among the top for PRin almost all subjects. It sounds great, but it is actually a double PU-edged swords. SIsword. Because of that, I did not have the incentives to perfect my English. Then I got a job as a research associate, which did not require a lot of RSinteractions with other people either. However, it is different now as I have moved from the academic field to the commercial world. In the business world, I need to communicate with people much more often. I need to present and explain my work not just to people in my specialized area but also PRin other departments. So I am spending a lot of time learning and improving my English now. That's why I have joined englishtown.com.

I used to be a tutor at an university. I taught classes of around 20-30 people. One day, when I was teaching in a classPU, I noticed that some people stealthy glanced at my jeans. Of course, my mother just bought me the jeans, they are new and nice. RS I kept on lecturing mathematics. About a half hour passed, I started asking people questions to make sure they understand the materials. I picked a female student. She mumbled and her face turned red. Her eyes were avoiding me. I thought hmm Dwhat's wrong with this girl today, she normally is very active and certainly not aD timid. I linked everything together and induced that there must be some thing wrong with my jeans. I looked down. Oh, my gosh. My jeans'SPjean's zipper was all the way down and the underwear was not properly aligned. You know what I mean. The zipper went down by itself, not to mention the underwear as well. The jeans were from Vietnam. It was some years ago though, the quality of jeans and underwear there are much better now. It was a very awkward situation for me.

I haven't MWbeen actively involved in office politics in my career. Partly because my job is doing WCgathering research. However, thinking of which, I probably have beenMW involved in office politics throughout Dwithout awarenessWC being aware of it. When I was a student and applied for tutoring positions.D I got the positions straight away, no interviews whatsoever. Reflecting on that, it was probably because I had good relationships with my teachers. When I finished my undergrad, my supervisor gave me a job. I did not even have to find one. Recently, I joined the commercial world and have seen much moreMW cases PRof office politics. In a company that I worked for, I frequently heard people talk WCsay bad things about others behind their back. A colleague and a director shouted at each other fiercely about a project. The colleague then stormed out of the office and screamed that he would never come back. I watched these things silently. Undoubtedly, this is not the bestMW response PRto politics either.D MWas I did not gain many people's support. Of course, I left the company after the WCmy contract ended. Nevertheless, I had learn WClearned some technical skills and personal skills while working for the company. It's not all bad.

What is important when you are a manager, is being a great leader. You have to understand that in addition to organise WCorganising the schedule, then production figures or something else, you also have to strongly excel in communication and fairness. I think that they are the two main valuable qualities which lead to sustainability. That makes people trust in you and promotes theD mutual trust in anD friendly mood by a clean approach. However, do not be too friendly with your team and make sure that itPOyou abidesD by the company rules. Then, try to truly understand each worker's personality and acknowledge their qualities. Make them happierWChappy to work for you doing what they like to. In one hand they are going to be more efficient on their tasks and on the other hand, most of the time what they like is linked to their main skills. In other words, give them and they will give you back. It all boils down to your leadership and your personality.

writing.topic: Buying a painting for a friend
writing.text: In my view, one major thing to become a leader is to know who you are. Being aware of its strengths and weaknesses is the first step a leader need. That leads it to a confidence in itself. If you ask me, school teachers do not teach this. Granted, it needs many skills learned by them, but it needs to experience and to learn from life, unless leadership is innate, so it feel that underneath. Even in this case the leader has to keep learning by leading something or some people to get more people skills. Then, it needs to know all the staff it is the head of, about workers'SPworker's jobs, and obviously about their personalities. Myself, it has to be a caring person who put itself in staff shoes sharing hardship as much as possible. It must set the example, be significantly communicative, and above all, do not use its position as an excuse to think it knows better than someone else. If you think of yourself as an efficient leader, you must remember that the team comes first, so your job actually mean nothing without it.

writing.topic: Writing a report on staff satisfaction
writing.text: Since I am 5 years old, I have been learning English, starting with colours and animals, to finally trying now to get PRto a proficient level. I thought that funny, then I was proud of myself PRfor knowing another language than my mother tongue and right now, I need it for working. Moreover, English is everywhere and even substitutes some French words. Even though we are used to seeWCseeing these words, English is more and more present. For instancesWCinstance, you could read some English in an advertisement or sometimes at the movie theater. By the way, it is more enjoyable watching a movie in its main language. Best of all, when you want to travel, as it is useful at work, you can easily realize that English is at least the second language in many countries. I can tell that being able to communicate all roundPRaround the world is obviously a good feeling. It helps me to learn English as I can practice it while enjoying. Now, I am feeling confident forPRabout speaking English RSfluently. I am improving and it is now easier for me to get a job after an interview. Anyway, I could maybe work in the US soon so I know how important it is for me to speak English.%%

It set when I was 17 at high school on a usual day. 4 friends and I talked about the teachers in the CDI, instead of being focused on our books, which were opened on the round table. The room was packed, so even though the students were whispering, it was relatively noisy. We did not mean to be heard, and I could tell that everybody around us did not understand. Unfortunately, one of them did hear what I was saying. I did not really pay attention to my friend passing from laughter to calm. While calming down, I finally realized that my friend, who was in front of me, looked embarrassed casting a look just above my head. I immediately stopped talking and slowly turned around, and I felt as if the room was now silent. Behind me the teacher I was offensively talking about stood up! She severely stared at me and yelled: "Come with me!" The room was doubtless quiet now. I was way out of line and after telling my insincere apologies I was in tremendous trouble. That is an other story, but I now know that what goes around comes around.

When you start a new job you have to get used to do it, and besides, you also have to be a part of the workers. When I started in my company for substituting someone else, I made the choice to stick to myself as Leo RS, a colleague I used to know atWCknew from school. It was not wonder to getWCno shock that this genuine backstabber had not changed at all. He climbed up the executive ladder, so he has the feeling to attain his goals, but more than three quarters of the company could not stand him. Granted, he became a manager, but he had to lead a team that did not respect him. By contrast, Rgis was used to beAGbeing thoughtful and supportive. He was as efficientMW in doing his job asCOand helping others doing some extra tasks. He did not climb up the executive ladder as high as Leo, but he always kept his commitment up. He got more and more responsibilities and it seemed as though it was not the end of his success.
